intro: Reichardia crassifolia, commonly known as the broad-leafed dandelion, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to North America and is characterized by its basal rosette of broad, spoon-shaped leaves. The plant produces a single, hollow, hairless stem that supports a single flower head composed of yellow ray florets. Reichardia crassifolia is often found in disturbed soils and open areas, and it is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its botanical features make it a common weed in gardens and agricultural fields.
